New Records: Australia amassed their highest successful World Cup run chase in the win over Bangladesh
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh hit 177* from 132 balls, hitting 26 boundaries and 9 sixes
David Warner took his time to get going as runs flowed at the other end
Marnus Labuschagne had a direct hand in four of Australia's dismissals
Bangladesh opener Tanzid Hasan was dismissed by Sean Abbott on his Cricket World Cup debut
Post-Match Reflections: Australia's dominant start to their chase hit a bump when Warner, who had begun to get bogged down, clipped a catch to Najmul Hossain Shanto
Marsh kicked on in style, supported by the returning Smith, to an outstanding knock of 177 from just 132 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh's top five batters each made at least 30 but only Hridoy (74) could turn a start into a fifty
Bangladesh were able to pass 300 and push toward their highest total of the tournament
Australia picked up regular wickets at the death to ensure it was a target they would still be confident of reaching
Others: Pat Cummins won the toss and opted to bowl first in Pune
Glenn Maxwell had been handed a well-earned rest to get himself back into peak condition for the knockout stages
Australia's top-order strength was on full display in Pune as they made short work of what could have been a challenging total
